home.content:
# Lecture 11: Logic and Arrays
---

Welcome to Lecture 11! Here's a brief breakdown of today's class.

#### Learning Objectives
---
1. Understand how to perform multi-tiered conditional logic statements in javascript
2. Understand how arrays work and why they are needed

#### Final Projects
---
**Next Monday**: please bring a wireframe of your final project.

#### Homework Reminder
---
**This Wednesday**: the [Batman assignment](https://fewdmaterials.github.io/BatmanGame/) is due.

#### Rundown
---
Ok game time.

#### [Warmup](#warmup)
#### [Functions and Conditionals](#functions-and-conditionals)
#### [Arrays](#arrays)

desc.content: Continuing on javascript conditional statements and intro to arrays.

arrays.content:
# Arrays --- ## [JS Global Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JS_Arrays) | [LIVE Instructor View](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JS_Arrays)

#### Learning Objectives --- 1. What are arrays and how can we leverage them to solve problems? 2. How can arrays be used with functions? #### Exercises --- #### [PSET - Arrays](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/Arrays_PSET) | [LIVE Instructor Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/Arrays_PSET) #### [PSET - Shopping List](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JavaScript_Shopping_List) | [LIVE Instructor Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JavaScript_Shopping_List)

#### Arrays 101 --- Arrays are effectively lists that we can leverage to solve problems. ```js const arr = []; // create an empty array // create a prefilled array const nums = [1,2,3,4]; // access values const firstVal = nums[0]; // length of array const len = nums.length; // 4 const lenOfArr = arr.length; // 0 ```
